| Group |

 | 2019 | 2018
 | S$ Mil | S$ Mil
Mobile service (1) | 5,395.7 | 5,737.3
Sale of equipment | 2,876.7 | 2,414.5
Handset operating lease income | 140.5 | 25.2
Mobile | 8,412.9 | 8,177.0
Data and Internet | 3,340.9 | 3,435.7
Business solutions | 604.1 | 560.7
Cyber security | 548.7 | 527.1
Other managed services | 1,880.8 | 1,920.0
Infocomm Technology (“ICT”) (2) | 3,033.6 | 3,007.8
Digital businesses (3) | 1,245.3 | 1,113.1
Fixed voice | 899.0 | 1,084.3
Pay television | 372.7 | 369.4
Others (4) | 67.3 | 80.7
Operating revenue | 17,371.7 | 17,268.0
Operating revenue | 17,371.7 | 17,268.0
Other income | 224.7 | 258.8
Interest and investment income (see Note 10) | 38.1 | 45.5
Total | 17,634.5 | 17,572.3

paragraph 1: Operating Revenue
paragraph 2: Notes: (1) Includes revenues from subscription (prepaid/postpaid), interconnect, outbound and inbound roaming, wholesale revenue from MVNOs (Mobile Virtual Network Operators) and mobile content services such as music and video.
paragraph 3: (2) Includes equipment sales related to ICT services.
paragraph 4: (3) Mainly from provisions of digital marketing and advertising services and regional premium OTT video.
paragraph 5: (4) Includes energy reselling fees.
paragraph 6: As at 31 March 2019, the transaction price attributable to unsatisfied performance obligations for ICT services rendered by NCS Pte. Ltd. is approximately S$3 billion which will be recognised as operating revenue mostly over the next 5 years.
As at 31 March 2019, the transaction price attributable to unsatisfied performance obligations for ICT services rendered by NCS Pte. Ltd. is approximately S$3 billion which will be recognised as operating revenue mostly over the next 5 years.
paragraph 7: Service contracts with consumers typically range from a month to 2 years, and contracts with enterprises typically range from 1 to 3 years.

qa.question: What is the transaction price attributable to unsatisfied performance obligations for ICT services rendered by NCS Pte. Ltd.?
